channel.title: Making a static ip (Needing help badly)
channel.description: i need help making a static ip i got the ip adress, the subnet Mask, and the default gateway, also i got the DHCP server and DNS servers can anyone help the default gateway and the DHCP and DNS ips are all the same, im in real need of help, please help

item.title: Making a static ip (Needing help badly)
item.dc:creator: @Airo_HNTD Airo HNTD
item.description:
@Airo_HNTD wrote:

[quote=“whitefang1, post:1, topic:361465”]i need help making a static ip i got the ip adress, the subnet Mask, and the default gateway, also i got the DHCP server and DNS servers can anyone help the default gateway and the DHCP and DNS ips are all the same,
im in real need of help, please help[/quote]

This sounds like you’re using a router. The router is configured to act as a DHCP and DNS server whilst also being your default gateway. This is normal in a HAN (Home Area Network).

As for assigning a static IP address, it depends on your router, they are usually all different in a very slight way. But that can make it confusing.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a static ip (Needing help badly)
